org.apache.twill.internal

Class AbstractTwillController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.twill.internal.AbstractExecutionServiceController
      • org.apache.twill.internal.AbstractZKServiceController
        • org.apache.twill.internal.AbstractTwillController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.common.util.concurrent.Service, ServiceController, TwillController

    public abstract class AbstractTwillController
extends AbstractZKServiceController
implements TwillController
    A abstract base class for TwillController implementation that uses Zookeeper to controller a running twill application.

      • changeInstances

        public final com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Integer> changeInstances(String runnable,
                                                                                         int newCount)
        Description copied from interface: TwillController
        Changes the number of running instances of a given runnable.
        Specified by:
        changeInstances in interface TwillController
        Parameters:
        runnable - The name of the runnable.
        newCount - Number of instances for the given runnable.
        Returns:
        A Future that will be completed when the number running instances has been successfully changed. The future will carry the new count as the result. If there is any error while changing instances, it'll be reflected in the future.

      • updateLogLevels

        public Future<Map<String,LogEntry.Level>> updateLogLevels(Map<String,LogEntry.Level> logLevels)
        Description copied from interface: TwillController
        Update the log levels for requested logger names for Twill applications running in a container. The log level for a logger name can be null except for the root logger, which will reset the log level for the specified logger.
        Specified by:
        updateLogLevels in interface TwillController
        Parameters:
        logLevels - The Map contains the requested logger names and log levels that need to be updated.
        Returns:
        A Future that will be completed when the log level update has been done. It will carry the Map of log levels as the result.

      • updateLogLevels

        public Future<Map<String,LogEntry.Level>> updateLogLevels(String runnableName,
                                                          Map<String,LogEntry.Level> runnableLogLevels)
        Description copied from interface: TwillController
        Update the log levels for requested logger names for a TwillRunnable. The log level for a logger name can be null except for the root logger, which will reset the log level for the specified logger.
        Specified by:
        updateLogLevels in interface TwillController
        Parameters:
        runnableName - The name of the runnable to update the log level.
        runnableLogLevels - The Map contains the requested logger name and log level that need to be updated.
        Returns:
        A Future that will be completed when the log level update has been done. It will carry the Map of log levels as the result.

      • resetLogLevels

        public Future<String[]> resetLogLevels(String... loggerNames)
        Description copied from interface: TwillController
        Reset the log levels of all runnables. The log levels will be the same as when the runnables start up.
        Specified by:
        resetLogLevels in interface TwillController
        Parameters:
        loggerNames - The optional logger names to be reset for all runnables, if not provided, all log levels will be reset.
        Returns:
        A Future that will be completed when the set log level operation has been done. The future result is the logger names provided in the parameter.

      • resetRunnableLogLevels

        public Future<String[]> resetRunnableLogLevels(String runnableName,
                                               String... loggerNames)
        Description copied from interface: TwillController
        Reset the log levels of the given runnable. The log levels will be same as when the runnable starts up.
        Specified by:
        resetRunnableLogLevels in interface TwillController
        loggerNames - The optional logger names to be reset for the runnable, if not provided, all log levels will be reset.
        Returns:
        A Future that will be completed when the set log level operation has been done. The future result is the logger names provided in the parameter.

      • resetLogHandler

        protected final void resetLogHandler()
        Reset the log handler to poll from the beginning of Kafka.
